text: Bangkok Vienna and I arrived here a few

first Manila for three months
and after the last eight months of

down and make Thailand capital
our next home base we are loving the

Dan about so much stuff shopping today I
also bought some stuff we are so excited
for this next chapter in our life
because having a home means we can

high it means we can replace a hundred

use our own washing machine to wash
clothes have a fridge full of food to
cook fresh up and in your home and join

cruising through Bangkok at night on a

you like we already have local SIM cards
signed up for an awesome co-working

here are five reasons why we moved to
Bangkok
one we love Southeast Asia this region
has unbelievably nice people incredible
food amazing nature
beaches jungles mountains and it's also
very convenient everywhere you go in the
city there's another market with more
street food we feel most happy and at
home here it's also near the Philippines
where Deana is from - it's very cheap
we've both been to Bangkok several times
before settling here and we agree that
it's the cheapest liveable big city in
the world our one bedroom apartment is
450 bucks a month total which includes
access to a pool and a gym just walk
into any 7-eleven and see how cheap a
water bottle is or a bottle of shampoo
it's great
three there's good Wi-Fi Bangkok's Wi-Fi
speeds are as fast as you can find
almost anywhere in the world Wi-Fi is
available everywhere from the MRT to
open parks to coffee shop it takes me 10
seconds to upload a video here where in
some places it takes up to four hours
long story short it makes our work lives
a lot more efficient for it's a hub our
new apartment is only 15 minutes away
from Bangkok's main International
Airport which makes it very convenient
to fly anywhere
many big airlines fly into Bangkok so
it's a perfect spot to have a base five
great networking Bangkok is huge with
many expats and locals and there's also
a huge community of digital nomads we
want to stay in a place long enough to
get acquainted with like-minded people
as I mentioned we signed up for a
co-working space called hubba and we're
already meeting awesome people so if you
guys are planning to visit Bangkok in

I'm drew Binh ski and if you like my
